avalancheActivity.comment: The new heavy rainfall will increase and overload the significant layer of recent snow that has not yet consolidated; the threat rating will remain 4 Strong. The detachment will be possible with a low overload, especially on many steep slopes and in particular where old mantle is present (northern exposures). To the south, the entire recent snow cover rests, almost entirely, on unfrozen uncovered ground, a condition that will favor accentuated snow flow phenomena. Numerous natural avalanches, both ground and surface, of large and very large dimensions will be possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Very cloudy or overcast with extensive precipitation. Snowfall level rising from 1200-1400 m on all sectors up to 1600-2000 m, with the highest levels in the east. New accumulations expected between 20 and 40 cm on the Prealps and Orobie. Avalanche danger 4 strong above the treeline.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new heavy quantities of snow expected will lead to a significant overload of the snowpack which presents very weak consolidation in the recently formed surface layers.

avalancheActivity.comment: New moderate amounts of snow will increase and overload the recent widespread accumulations which will present moderate to weak consolidation on many steep slopes. The triggering will be possible even with a low overload, generating very large avalanches. Numerous large and even very large spontaneous releases will be possible, especially where snowfall will be greater.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Very cloudy or overcast with extensive precipitation. Snowfall level rising from 1200-1400 m on all sectors up to 1600-2000 m, with the highest levels in the east. New accumulations expected between 20 and 40 cm on Adamello, 10-20 cm on the Rhaetian sectors. Avalanche danger 4 strong above the treeline.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new heavy quantities of snow expected will lead to a significant overload of the snowpack which presents very weak consolidation in the recently formed surface layers.

avalancheActivity.comment: The new snow will settle on a layer resting on unfrozen exposed ground. During the day, the progressive rise in temperatures will lead to rain up to the highest altitudes, with progressive humidification of the snow cover. Due to the weakening of the snowpack, releases and spontaneous releases of medium-sized and, in individual cases, large-sized ground avalanches will be possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Disturbed weather with widespread rain up to 1800 m.

snowpackStructure.comment: Progressively humidifying snow cover during the phases of rain mixed with snow. On the southern slopes, snow flow phenomena are possible, with basal slips that will affect the entire surface of the snowpack.

avalancheActivity.comment: Very thin layers of snow resting on uncovered ground. Possible isolated ground discharges on steep slopes at higher altitudes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Disturbed weather with widespread rain up to 1800 m.

snowpackStructure.comment: Snow cover of small thickness, resting on uncovered and thawed ground. Possible snow flow phenomena favored by the progressive humidification of the snowpack due to widespread rainfall.
